chapter.title: Host Emulator (HostEmu)
chapter.para: HostEmu is a subcommand environment that partially emulates a TSO/CMS environment. It provides a small subset of commands avaliable in those environments which make the transition from a real host Rexx programming environment to a Linux/Windows ooRexx environment much easier. The following subcommands are available:

The HostEmu HI, TS, TE commands have no arguments that are acceptable in the HostEmu environment. Thus their syntax is very simple. The EXECIO subcommand is more complicated and requires some explanation. It is a simplified version of the mainframe command but will provide most of the functionality you will need on a daily basis.

section.title: Command Options

listitem.para: Specifies the number of records (text lines) to read or write.
Specifies that all remaining records are to be read or written.
The operation is a disk read operation.
The operation os a disk write operation.
The name of the file for the disk operation. This option MUST be enclosed in double quotes.
The file will be closed at the end of the operation.
The operation is works against the specified stem. A trailing period is required or the name will be used as the root of a standard Rexx variable name.
Specifies that instead of a Rexx stem The Rexx SESSION queue should be used. The queue will be read or written to using LIFO.
Specifies that instead of a Rexx stem The Rexx SESSION queue should be used. The queue will be read or written to using FIFO.
Specifies the number of records (text lines) to be skipped. No stem or queue operations will be performed in this case.

section.para: Note that the LIFO, FIFO and SKIP options are not valid for DISKW operations.
These options should provide almost all of the EXECIO operations you will need in the non-mainframe operating system environment.
